intro: Diodia ocymifolia, commonly known as white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Diodia ocymifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
